Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rajagopal V
Reviews.Content: Centro Colon near Plaza de Colón is a perfect place for tourist, they charge around 80Euros per day, the rooms are spacious and neat, The lobby is perfect for free wifi if you have a laptop or tab, centrally located

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A_Ward509
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Centrol Colon twice, once for five weeks last May and for two weeks this March. The first time I stayed I had two pull down single beds, which for me, were hard to pull down and lock in place. The second time, I had a double fixed bed - which was very comfortable. The rooms are a bit dated, but has everything you need, especially for a longer stay. The kitchen is good - but they don't provide enough utensils and cutlery. The only gripe I have, is that the signal in the block is poor and I find it hard to connect to the internet (via USB, rented from reception). Overall the apartment is clean, quite and well sized, but could do with some modernisation. The staff are friendly and helpful - always saying hello etc. The location is fantastic - you can easily walk to all the central parts in the city. There is also a lounge area on the ground floor as well as a cafe on the 'club' floor, but I would recommend Cafe Rio Frio next door (same building, different entrance) as the food and service is better as is the opening hours.

Reviews.Title: “Right at Colon sq., great location. Very handy.”
Reviews.Author: R-eyesplice
Reviews.Content: The room is a little old, with pull-down beds. At first it seems odd, but it does add more space to the room in case you actually want to stay there for long. The kitchen is enough for an aparthotel, although I didn't use it. The bathroom had been refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: natanTel_Aviv_Israel
Reviews.Content: This place is a kind of mixture between hotel and apartments. It has great location in Madrid (right at the Placa Colon) next to a metro stop. However, the place is rundown, the furniture has seen better days. The staff is indifferent and at times even quite rude. The price is OK for Madrid but you can do better. There is a lot of noise from the streets coming in, the rooms are quite dirty for Spanish standards. We had a bedrom and a living room with a sleeping couch. Wouldn't go back.
